Run the FraNchEstYN crop–disease simulation or calibration

Source: R/Main.R
franchestyn.Rd

Runs the FraNchEstYN C# model from R. The function prepares inputs (weather, management, parameters, reference), writes them next to the package executable, builds a JSON config, launches the EXE, and streams live console output (RMSE updates overwrite on one line). Users do not manage paths or config files manually.

Usage

franchestyn(
  weather_data,
  management_data,
  reference_data = NULL,
  cropParameters = NULL,
  diseaseParameters = NULL,
  calibration = "disease",
  disease = "Septoria",
  start_end = c(2000, 2025),
  ...
)

Arguments

weather_data

A data frame for one site only (the function stops if multiple sites are present). A Site column (case-insensitive) is required. Date fields must exist via any of these aliases (case-insensitive; spaces, underscores and dashes ignored):

  • Year: year, yr, yyyy

  • Month: month, mo, mn

  • Day: day, dy, dd

  • Hour (only if hourly): hour, hr, hh

The time step is auto-detected from column names: if any of hour, hours, hourly, hr, hod is present (case/space/underscore-insensitive), the model assumes hourly; otherwise daily. Other meteorological variables are passed through as-is.

management_data

A data frame with management information for the same site. Must include columns: crop, variety, resistance, sowingDOY, year. The function adds a site column internally and writes sowing.csv for the EXE.

reference_data

Optional data frame with observed data, required when calibration != "none". Column requirements (case-insensitive; spaces, underscores and dashes ignored) follow the C# loader:

Required date & key fields

  • Variety: one of variety, cultivar, cv

  • Year: one of year, yr

  • DOY: one of doy, day_of_year, dy, d

Date is reconstructed as as.Date(paste0(year, "-01-01")) + doy.

Optional measurements (read if present; empty or "NA" are skipped)

  • Light interception (fint): fint, f_int, lightInterception, lightint, lightinterception

  • Grain yield: yield, grain_yield, yld, wgrn

  • Above-ground biomass (AGB): agb, above_ground_biomass, biomass, abovegroundbiomass, wtop

Disease severity (required if calibration is "disease", "disease:NAME", or "all")

A column matching the disease argument, or "<disease>_sev", "<disease>_severity".

cropParameters

A nested list of crop parameters (typically from FraNchEstYN::cropParameters, e.g. cropParameters$Wheat). Each parameter is a list with fields: description, unit, min, max, value, calibration (logical).

diseaseParameters

A nested list of disease parameters (e.g. diseaseParameters$Septoria). Same structure as cropParameters.

calibration

Character; target of the run. One of: "none", "crop", "disease", "disease:NAME", "all". Matching is case-insensitive; "disease:NAME" overrides the disease argument with NAME.

disease

Character; disease name to simulate/calibrate (default "Septoria"). If disease calibration is requested, a column with this name (or its _sev/_severity variants) must exist in reference_data.

start_end

Numeric length-2 vector: start and end years (default c(2000, 2025)). Must satisfy start_end[1] <= start_end[2].

...

Advanced options (not shown to typical users). Currently: iterations (integer; default 100). Used only when calibration != "none"; otherwise ignored.

Value

(Invisibly) a list with metadata (detected timestep, mode, calibrationModel, site, paths used, output directory). Model result files are produced by the EXE in outputs/.

Details

  • The function enforces a single site in weather_data.

  • Column name checks are case-insensitive and tolerant to spaces/underscores/dashes.

  • Input files are written under the installed package’s inst/bin tree near FraNchEstYN.exe (weather, parameters, reference, management).

  • A JSON config is generated and passed to the EXE.

  • Previous CSV outputs in the outputs folder are removed before running.

  • Console output from the EXE is streamed live; progress lines use to update in place, and the run ends with a newline + summary message.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
franchestyn(
  weather_data      = weather_df,      # one site; Year/Month/Day (+ Hour if hourly)
  management_data   = mgmt_df,         # crop/variety/resistance/sowingDOY/year
  reference_data    = ref_df,          # required when calibrating
  cropParameters    = cropParameters$Wheat,
  diseaseParameters = diseaseParameters$Septoria,
  calibration       = "all",
  disease           = "Septoria",
  start_end         = c(2010, 2020),
  iterations        = 200              # via ...
)
} # }
